what_we_test_for.title: SQL Injection
what_we_test_for.description: Detecting flaws where attackers can inject malicious SQL queries into your web application.

what_we_test_for.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS):
what_we_test_for.description: Finding vulnerabilities that allow attackers to inject scripts into web pages viewed by other users.

what_we_test_for.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
what_we_test_for.description: Testing for weaknesses that allow attackers to trick users into performing unintended actions on the application.

what_we_test_for.title: Authentication Flaws
what_we_test_for.description: Testing for insecure or weak authentication mechanisms.

what_we_test_for.title: Broken Access Control
what_we_test_for.description: Ensuring that users cannot access unauthorized resources.

what_we_test_for.title: Session Management Issues
what_we_test_for.description: Identifying flaws in how session tokens are handled, leading to potential session hijacking.

what_we_test_for.title: Security Misconfigurations
what_we_test_for.description: Ensuring that the application is configured securely and follows best practices.

methadology: Manual and automated tests to identify common vulnerabilities and security weaknesses.
Simulating real-world attacks, like brute force, XSS, and SQL injection, to evaluate the application's defences.
A comprehensive report with severity ratings and remediation steps.

children.title: Red Teaming
children.desc1: Red Teaming is a form of simulated cyber-attacks where AESPARROW acts as an adversary to test and evaluate your organization’s defenses. Our Red Teaming service simulates real-world attack scenarios to uncover weaknesses in your systems, processes, and people, providing a comprehensive assessment of your security resilience.

includes.title: Simulated Attacks
includes.description: Conducting realistic attacks on your systems, networks, and applications to test your security defences, including penetration testing, social engineering, and physical security assessments.

includes.title: Exploitation of Vulnerabilities
includes.description: Identifying and exploiting weaknesses in your security to determine the potential impact of a real-world breach.

includes.title: Advanced Attack Techniques
includes.description: Using sophisticated attack methods such as lateral movement, privilege escalation, and evading detection tools to simulate a real adversary’s tactics.

includes.title: Physical Security Testing
includes.description: Testing the physical security of your premises, including access controls, employee vigilance, and vulnerability to physical breaches.

includes.title: Social Engineering Attacks
includes.description: Testing the human factor by attempting to manipulate employees into revealing sensitive information or granting unauthorized access.

includes.title: Post-Engagement Reporting
includes.description: After the exercise, AESPARROW provides a comprehensive report detailing the vulnerabilities found, how they were exploited, the potential impact of the attack, and recommendations for improving your defences.

includes.title: Remediation and Retesting
includes.description: Following the Red Team exercise, we work with your team to remediate any weaknesses identified, and conduct a retest to ensure that vulnerabilities have been effectively addressed.

benifits: Realistic assessment of your organization’s defences, including people, processes, and technology.
Identification of vulnerabilities that could be exploited in a real-world attack.
Improved preparedness for cyber-attacks by identifying gaps in detection, response, and recovery.
Enhanced collaboration between security teams and the broader organization to address security weaknesses.
